CatDescriptText: Harvey Chandler, 2341 Centre Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the recreational facilities for young people in Pittsburgh are adequate? If not, what do you think should be done about it?" answer reads: "I do not.  We do not have adequate facilities for the children to enjoy sports like baseball and football.  I think that the city should provide for the facilities so that the youngsters will have a place to go and will keep them off the streets.  There is a tax for everything else, therefore, there might as well be a tax for recreation for youth."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harvey Chandler wearing light colored overcoat with top button fastened, and light colored fedora with dark band, posed in front of block building
